# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""
    
    # Loop over the markdown document, looking for julia code blocks
    for line in split(md, "\n")
        if startswith(line, "```julia") || startswith(line, "```Julia")
            # Start of a code block is found
            in_code_block = true
        elseif endswith(line, "```") && in_code_block
            # End of a code block is found
            in_code_block = false
        elseif in_code_block
            # Append the line to the extracted code
            extracted_code *= line * "\n"
        end
    end
    
    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the extracted code
    extracted_code = strip(extracted_code)
    
    return extracted_code
end

# Example usage
md = """```julia
println("hello world")
```"""

extract_julia_code(md) # Output: "println(\"hello world\")\n"
